item.title: Raw: Using OpenSSL to create a certificate authority and update IIS 7.5
item.description: A raw dump of information on how to create a certificate authority and etcetera.

item.title: Getting started with StatSVN (0.7.0) and CollabNet Subversion Server
item.description: While a tool like TortoiseSVN allows limited reporting on Subversion repositories, using a tool like StatSVN generates much more useful reports.

item.title: Upgrading Subversion 1.5.x to 1.6.0 on Windows Vista - checklist
item.description: Subversion 1.6.0 released a short time ago, and all the Windows binaries are ready to go. Here's a checklist (which should be applicable for future use) on Subversion, Apache, and TortoiseSVN upgrading.

item.title: Subversion 1.5.3 and TortoiseSVN 1.5.4 released
item.description: The newest versions of Subversion and TortoiseSVN were released just last week.

item.title: Installing Subversion binaries for Apache 2.2.x
item.description: In this article we'll be covering the installation of Subversion to work with Apache 2.2.x.

item.title: Install Apache 2.2.9 to Windows Vista (Ultimate)
item.description: Overview of installing Apache 2.2.9 to Windows Vista Ultimate, along-side IIS.

item.title: Errata: Apache JMeter
item.description: Errata I submitted for Apache JMeter, by Emily H. Halili.

item.title: Configuring Apache for per-user pages
item.description: How to configure Apache 2.2.4 on Ubuntu 7.04 for per-user pages.

item.title: Quickie: Install ColdFusion 7.02 on Ubuntu 7.04 with Apache 2.2.4
item.description: Quick notes on installing ColdFusion MX 7 (Developer Edition) to Ubuntu 7.04.

item.title: Quickie: Install Apache 2.2.4 on Ubuntu
item.description: Quickie of how I installed Apache 2.2.4 to Ubuntu.

item.title: Installing Apache 2.2.4 to a Windows-based computer, locally: Part 1
item.description: In this article, we'll be covering how to install Apache 2.2.4 to a local, Windows XP Home Edition, computer.

item.title: Upgrading PHP (4.4.2 to 4.4.4 and 5.1.4 to 5.2.0)
item.description: In this article, we'll be upgrading PHP, both 4.4.2 to 4.4.4 and 5.1.4 to 5.2.0.

item.title: Is it past time for Microsoft to open IIS?
item.description: Is it time for Microsoft to release a developer edition of IIS? This writer thinks so.

item.title: Installing Apache 2.0.59 to a Windows-based computer, locally: Part 4
item.description: In the last part of the Apache 2.0.59 installation guide, we cover creating batch files to switch between various instances of Apache, PHP, and ColdFusion. In a later guide we'll clean this process up considerably, but until then ...

item.title: Installing Apache 2.0.59 to a Windows-based computer, locally: Part 3
item.description: In part three of this multi-part guide, we'll be porting over from an Apache 1.3.x Web server to an Apache 2.0.x Web server by adding support for PHP 4.4.2 and PHP 5.1.4. We also go over how to setup MySQL and PostgreSQL for our new version of Apache. In the last guide of this series, we'll be going over how to create batch files to switch between all of the different possible servers we can now run.
